content: Source control tools are used in software development to manage and track changes made to the code base by multiple developers. It helps to keep track of the different versions of the code, enables collaboration among developers, and provides a backup of the code in case of any bugs or problems. Some popular source control tools include Git, Mercurial, and Subversion. These tools are essential for managing and tracking changes in the code, ensuring that the final product is error-free, and making it easier to roll back to a previous version of the code if necessary.
